intro: Eriogonum ursinum, commonly known as bear's milk, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture. Eriogonum ursinum is adapted to dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
